title: School of Evocation

feature_defs.trigger: when you add an evocation spell to your spellbook
effects: the gold and time you must spend to copy the spell are halved

feature_defs.trigger: when a creature succeeds on a saving throw against your cantrip or when you miss with a cantrip attack roll
effects: the creature takes half the cantrip’s damage (if the cantrip deals damage)
limits: does not apply if the cantrip has no damage

feature_defs.trigger: when you cast an evocation spell that affects other creatures you can see
effects: choose a number of those creatures equal to 1 + the spell’s level
chosen creatures automatically succeed on saving throws against the spell
chosen creatures take no damage if the spell would normally deal half damage on a successful save

feature_defs.trigger: when you roll damage for a wizard evocation spell
effects: add your Intelligence modifier to one damage roll
limits: add Intelligence modifier only once per spell

feature_defs.trigger: when you cast a wizard spell of levels 1–5 that deals damage
effects: you can choose to maximize the spell’s damage
limits: first use between long rests has no drawback
each additional use before a long rest deals necrotic damage to you per subclass text, increasing by 1d12 each time
this necrotic damage ignores resistance and immunity
notes: Rules engine should track overchannel_uses_since_long_rest to compute backlash dice.
Sculpt Spells protects 1 + spell level creatures and prevents half-damage spillover on success.
